page.title: 05ARABLE FARMING -LILLESHALL.
page.content: {75%}of our area is covered by{arable land.Farmers these days find it cheaper to run an arable farm instead of dairy.They buy a{large area}of land about{300-400 acres}and cut down most of the hedges to make{larger fields}so they can fit the{big machinery}in like Combine Harvesters,Ploughs,Bailers and Corndrills. We visited 4 big farms out of 5 in our area,three of them were arable,one mixed and the other was a dairy farmer ,but his farm was smaller. {99%}of arable farmers{grow wheat and {barley}as a yearly crop and 75% grow potatoes and sugar beet and sometimes the occasional farmer grows beans,peas and maize.
